``` ::: ::: ## Exploratory Data Analysis: Distribution and Ranking ### 1️⃣ GDP per capita — Distribution ::: {#00cd86e4 .cell execution_count=3} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Mean: $20,346 | Median: $7,588 | 10th–90th pct: $1,000 – $53,383 ``` ::: ::: ::: {#cell-fig-gdp-hist .cell execution_count=4} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![Distribution of GDP per capita across countries (2022).](report_files/figure-html/fig-gdp-hist-output-1.png){#fig-gdp-hist width=566 height=374} ::: ::: **Interpretation.** As shown in Figure @fig-gdp-hist, the distribution of GDP per capita in 2022 is highly right-skewed, with a mean of $20,346 and a median of $7,588. This large gap indicates that a few very high-income countries pull up the global average. Most countries lie between $1,000 and $53,000 (10th–90th percentile), showing that the majority of economies fall in low- to middle-income ranges. --- ### 2️⃣ Life expectancy — Distribution ::: {#fbabaefa .cell execution_count=5} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Mean: 72.4 years | Median: 73.5 years | 10th–90th pct: 61.4 – 82.2 years ``` ::: ::: ::: {#cell-fig-life-hist .cell execution_count=6} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![Distribution of life expectancy across countries (2022).](report_files/figure-html/fig-life-hist-output-1.png){#fig-life-hist width=566 height=374} ::: ::: **Interpretation.** Figure @fig-life-hist shows that life expectancy is centered around the mid-70s. In contrast with GDP per capita (Figure @fig-gdp-hist), its distribution is much more symmetric, suggesting smaller inequality across countries in health outcomes. --- ### 3️⃣ Inflation rate — Ranking ::: {#b911ceab .cell execution_count=7} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Global average (sample): 12.49% | Average among the same 15: 12.48% | Count above global avg: 5/15 ``` ::: ::: ::: {#cell-fig-inflation-bar .cell execution_count=8} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![Inflation rate (annual %, 2022) among 15 most populous countries.](report_files/figure-html/fig-inflation-bar-output-1.png){#fig-inflation-bar width=566 height=374} ::: ::: **Interpretation.** Figure @fig-life-hist shows that life expectancy is centered around the mid-70s. In contrast with GDP per capita (Figure @fig-gdp-hist), its distribution is much more symmetric, suggesting smaller inequality across countries in health outcomes. --- ### 4️⃣ Summary statistics table ::: {#tbl-summary .cell tbl-cap='Summary statistics for three analyzed indicators (2022).' execution_count=9} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=45} ```{=html}
